name: IFA Villas Bavaro Resort & Spa

reviews.title: IFA Villas and Village Punta Cana
reviews.text: Just got back from 1 week at the IFA VILLAS Punta Cana. 3 couples went together and we got an easy upgrade to the Village area without even asking for it! The rating by Apple was a 3 but I would give it an upgrae to 4 1/2 apples. The rooms were above average, the landscaping was above average, the beach was excellent but lacking shades cabanas( I took an umbrella and 2 C clamps) and made my own shade. But really didn't use the seats often. The food was 1 of the best that I ever ate , and I been to Punta Cana 5 times now. The 3 special restaurants weren't the best I ever had, but the 3 buffets had a lot of varieties changing of some kind every seating. The staff was above average and I didn't have 1 complaint other that the Disco didn't change music varieties enough, too much Spanish and hardly any American. I couldn't stay up past midnight any ways. The pool music was above average and the beach music was very good too! Didn't take any tour other then the reef snorkling for 2 hrs for $20.00 was nice and we stopped off to see the shark and moray eels caged area also. The shops were the type you had to bargain for but since I was there 4 other times I knew all the angles and made great deals for myself and others. I usually too 75% off of 1st pricing then added more items and got great deals for around 60% off of starting prices. I don't know where the other reviews said the drinks were watered down because ours were very strong and if you just got shots they would knock you quickly. A few times depending on what bar you went (as there were 7 bars) they did do a few virgin drinks but I think it was just mistakes as the bartenders were very busy at all times. I would definitely recommend anyone to check out the deals at IFA VILLAS VILLAGE RESORT if size is not important to you, although this 1 was not too small but easiel to get around. I f money is not of a concern to you they this would not be the place for you! Costed us total: insurance, taxes, and all inclusive of $875. for 1 week where the larger resorts would cost you $1200-$1400. per person at this time of year. Hope I helped all! Wilddog

Non stop fun the whole time we were in the Dominican Republic. Eight of us went and everyone agreed the resort was great. The resort is a great deal. The rooms and grounds were very clean. The food was good and a lot of variety. We ate at all three ala carte restaurants. The Mexican and Japanese we're great. We didn't enjoy the International restaurant.
reviews.title: Great Vacation, Great Value, Great Atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The animation team is a blast. Out on the beach in the morning and midday (stretching, dance lessons, water aerobics). Around the pool in the afternoons and early evens (different contests daily). Great shows nightly. They finish off each night at the discotecha.
reviews.title: Can not wait to get back there!!!

reviews.text: Henri, Robert and Chocolate (animation team members) are all great. If you get a chance, talk with them. You will be laughing the whole time.
reviews.title: A Nice Place to Visit With a Great Price and Also a Beautiful Beach
Loved it! Didn't want to come home!
reviews.text: The beach is beautiful. Powder white sand and some large coral rocks at the edges of the swimming area. The are all kinds of fish swimming around the rocks. Watch out though, the sun is very strong and you will burn easily.

reviews.title: not sure where the other people stayed but we have no bad things to say......exc
reviews.text: First let me start off by saying I am not sure where all these other people stay but we vacationed from the 27 of March to 3 April. Our stay was fantastic right from the start, while it is true the hotel staff don't speak fluent english they do understand enough to make check in a breeze.........why not learn a little spanish the effort goes a long way.

Our room was spotless.....no bugs at all........we had one king bed.......you do need the key to run the electricity but you only need it on when your in the room right??????? The bathroom don't offer much privacy but I don't think this should ruin your vacation.........
reviews.title: You get MORE than what you pay for

reviews.text: The food on the buffet was fine but does get repetive after a while so we booked our a la carte reservations and the food at theses restaurant was excellent........
reviews.title: Great Holiday, Low Cost

reviews.text: We walked the beach and found that this hotel has one of the largest beach fronts and less seaweed, the staff do a great job in keeping everything clean.......
reviews.title: Don Not GO! they Poisoned Me! Then Food Poisoned- Did Not Take Any Action!
NOT RECOMENDED
reviews.text: The pools are amazing and there are three of them so you can always find charirs to sit .........or put your towels on them to reserve your favorite spot in the morning......

The hotel's staff and entertainment was wonderful. However, the stay was somewhat of a nightmare. To start, the third day there (after a long day at the pool) someone entered our room and left feces in the shower in particular the shower curtain. Not to mention, left a defecated towel left on the floor. When we reported the incident, the staff tried to accommodate us by transferring us to the Villas which was further away from most of the activities and smaller in size. We then asked for another room transfer which the room was less desirable. For instance, the tub was slightly rusted, some of bathroom tiles were loose, and the toilet moved along with us. In addition, the floor was slippery (and rather dangerous) because of the built up condensation.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Hotel Ifa was great, some reviewers are just such whingers!
reviews.text: As far as the restaurants, the food was okay but make sure you take a lot of antidiarrhea medication such as Imodium. To top it all, the advertising pictures of the hotel are antiquated and were probably taken ten years ago. Overall, I would never recommendation this hotel!

I wish to write an optomistic review of Hotel IFA villas to give hope to people who have booked to go there and may be apprehensive having read some of these reviews. I have just returned with my boyfriend and had a fantastic time, I really cannot fault the experience, just a few minor issues that did not affect my holiday at all.
reviews.title: We Got Broken In To.....

reviews.text: Accommodation - Better than expected, very spacious, excellent air-con, well-cleaned and maintained daily by maids. Sheets and towels changed, water replenished. Perfectly fine.
reviews.title: Good Value for R & R -- But not much else

likes.disliked: — Certain male staff members, lack of variety of activities, sweet and sugary cocktails, brahma beer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transfers/Rep - Transfers comfortable and punctual, no problems. Rep from Hola tours excellent, provided all info needed, gave us his mobile no, booked trip on our behalf.
reviews.title: Just ok!!

likes.disliked: — rooms, all the construction going on

reviews.text: I was happy to have visited the dominican but think I would have had a better time if I had stayed somewhere else. Not many english speaking people at this hotel. In 1 week I met 4 people. restaurants are small so if u don't book days in advance you don't get in..buffet was good different stuff added everyday. When it rains the grounds flood. Beds are extremely hard and pillows if u call them that are extremely small. Towels are a hit or miss sometimes they don't leave any when cleaning your room and u have to call for them and of course they expect a tip for delivery. No wash cloths. Pools are somewhat dirty even though they were cleaning them every day. Lots of loud people at 530 heading to their room when disco closes. definately wakes you up. Over all though staff was friendly. Management always made them selves known in restaurants and continually checked for quality. Sometimes if u don't specify alcohol in your drink you most likely will receive a virgin drink. Spa was great had a massage,manicure and pedicure very accomadating and reasonably priced. The shops do try to overcharge you when converting pesos to dollars or dollars to pesos. don't bother going to la palmera mall only like13 stores open and overpriced. Hotel was cheaper. captain cooke's had the best drinks and coffee. I would save a few extra dollars and go to a better hotel.
reviews.title: punta cana

reviews.text: This was my 4th trip to IFA...I know what to expect...and I keep coming back.
reviews.title: 4th trip to IFA

likes.liked: — I love the entire set up of IFA the way it's built
likes.disliked: — cateriing more to the Europeans then americans and we travel just as much

reviews.text: My son and I keep going back.
reviews.title: Stay some where else!!!!!!!!
Before you book, please read!
reviews.text: Yes everyone's words are true...water pressure can be low at times, but when you have over 200 people getting ready at the same time/at some points, it's going to happen. They have made many upgrades to this hotel..the grounds are immaculate, the people are wonderful and hey the food is carribbean. You aren't going to get a 5 course meal..you aren't going away to eat..it's to enjoy the lush and lavish beaches..purely soft w/little pink undertones..beautiful. The animation staff work day and night for you..non stop, friendly and caring people. I bring US dollars and tip the wait staff who remember you the next day and are back at your side. As long as the rooms are clean which they are, sheets are clean which they are and the air conditioning is working, who really stays in the rooms? you are out by 7am most of the times and back by 6 after the activities commence, getting ready for dinner. Latin music plays daily, chairs are abundant, towels are readily available and the weather is picture perfect most times.
If you want a 5 star hotel go there, pay for it..but if you want a great time for reasonable pricing, go to IFA...it's not as bad as what people are saying. :)
reviews.title: Asi Asi

reviews.text: IFA Villas Bavaro
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Date - Apirl 6, 2007
reviews.title: Good Value for the money

likes.disliked: — weak water pressure and outdated room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviewer - Traveler from PEI, Canada
reviews.title: Will be returning for sure.

likes.liked: — Close proximity to everything: food, beach, etc.

reviews.text: I was a little leary of making arrangements since it was only a 3.5 star. I stayed at a 4.5 star last year and the only difference was we had a tub in our room and we were very handy the beach. The villas are very quaint. There were three of us the in room and the sink was separate from the washroom. It was a great shower, all done in ceramic tile. The room was very clean. We had a great cleaning lady, Nancy. She left us flowers in the room and had our shoes and nightdresses arranged in a different setting each day we came back to the room. There is a bar with four whirlpools next to the villas. It was right outside our room. Not noisy at all. The only complaint is they didn't always have vino blanco (white wine).
reviews.title: Food was below par

reviews.text: It was a quite a long walk from the beach, 10-15 minutes but you had to go through the resort so there was lots to look at.
reviews.title: best time of my life. officialy.

reviews.text: My 3 friends and I had a great time at IFA Bavaro Ocean Beach. We are from New York City and visited from May 19-24. My friends and I are all single and in our twenties. We all wanted to relax during the day and party at night and we're able to do that at this resort.
reviews.title: This vacation was just what we needed!

likes.liked: — Beautiful beach and the great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Resort: The resort is huge and the grounds are kept extremely clean.
reviews.title: Awesome time......

likes.disliked: — says snorkeling including which is but want $30 deposit, how brings $$ to beach,,,,,

reviews.text: The Room: We stayed in the Ocean Beach Club which is the nicest and closest to the beach. The beds were a little hard, but it didn't really bother us. The TV didn't work, but it didn't matter because we were hardly ever in our room. The maid always kept it looking nice and clean even though we would accidentally bring in sand from the beach. The walls are very thin and a couple of times our neighbor came over to yell at us because we were too loud after the discotecha.
reviews.title: IFA Bavaro is Awesome!!

reviews.text: The Beach: Beautiful white/pink sand and the water was amazing. There is definitely a lack of shade, but that didn't bother me. The music on the beach was relaxing in the morning and the tempo picked up in the afternoon. The animation team always had something going on whether is was dance lessons, water aerobics, or games. Everyone should get to know Henry. He has a great personality and getting to know him will make your trip more fun. You can also rent kayaks, snorkeling equipment, and sailboats. You just have to leave a deposit.
reviews.title: Descent Vacation for the Price

reviews.text: The Food: On the day we arrived we made reservations for the Colonial and Japanese Restaurants. We really enjoyed these two restaurants and it was a nice change from the buffets. We hung out at the pizzeria a lot because it was by the main pool and the staff was a lot of fun. The pizza was pretty good and they also had nachos. The beach buffet was good for a quick snack. The main buffet was okay. I always found something to eat, but one of my friends was really picky and it was difficult for her to find food she liked.
reviews.title: Amazing resort for the value!

likes.liked: — I can't narrow it down to one thing - everything was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: watch the sunrise on day, beautiful site to see...
reviews.title: not worth the money

reviews.text: When we made our initial reservations with hotels.com for the IFAL Villas Resort Well our journey to the IFA Villas Bavaro Resort we had reserved two rooms due to the fact that we had 5 travelers. A day later the 5th traveler dropped out and we no longer needed the 2nd room. We called hotels.com and requested that we change our reservation to one room with four people in it. They said we shouldn’t cancel our reservation but they would call the hotel and tell them we would have a fourth member attending and told us it would be an extra $74 a night. We called the hotel looking for a shuttle service from the airport but they didn’t provide one, thus made it confusing when departing the airport.
reviews.title: should have been rated 2 star hotal not 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we finally arrived to the hotel we embarked a mayhem of people standing around the entire hotel counter trying to do a series of requests all at the SAME TIME WITH THE SAME HOTEL RECEPTIONIST. Once the receptionist attended my family she did not understand that we had a fourth member with us. She kept telling me no problem and handing me three of the hotel wristbands and three towel cards and two door openers. I kept explaining to her no we have a fourth person in both English and in Spanish. FINALLY she understood that the fourth person was with us and then sent me to yet another person. I waited in that line again to then be told that the rate is $88 a night per extra person. I told them that hotels.com had spoken to a Jon Carlos Tieba and that he told us that it would be $74. The receptionist then proceeded to tell me that person didn’t even work there. Then he was about to ring up all four people and told me the charge would be $770. He thought we were paying for all four people. That made me furious to realize that we had paid SO MUCH more than we should have but we didn’t really have a choice. So I said we have already paid for the three people and just need the fourth person. We took the $88 a night coming up to an additional $70 for the week than it should have been. It took over an hour and a forty-five minutes to check in and another fifteen minutes to get to our room.
reviews.title: Your experience is what you make it - ours was great

likes.disliked: — Only minor things - no big deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon getting to our room we only had two room keys. One room key was needed to keep in a holder to keep the electricity on and the air conditioner running. Two keys for the four people in the room because a tremendous hassle. It became an even more hassle when fellow room neighbors began kicking on doors for 5minutes at a time to be let into their hotel room between the hours of 2AM and 5:30AM. We never were able to sleep well during our stay due to the banging on the doors to be let in.
reviews.title: Would never go there again

reviews.text: The size of our rooms were crammed. The beds were extremely small for two people, the shower and bathrooms were open and visible to anyone walking around in the room leaving absolutely no privacy to any of us. The bathroom was extremely small.
reviews.title: Very Mixed Review

likes.liked: — The grounds were really nice and the biggest pool was really pretty
likes.disliked: — Loud disco/night noises. A/C did not work in our room or any of the other people's we talked to

reviews.text: On Wednesday morning I discovered a cricket in our room and was able to catch it and discard it. By the night time we discovered a spider as large as my hand crawling in the corner of our room. We quickly called the front desk and they said they would send someone over immediately. About fifteen minutes later someone showed up and bug fogged the area the spider was in and finally caught it. Later that night we found a water cockroach. From that moment on we were unable to sleep properly in the hotel room because we were so stressed out by the bug infestation. This made our stay extremely stressful because we were unable to change rooms due to the fact that the hotel was already fully booked.
reviews.title: Ppl that complain have serious issues

reviews.text: IFA VILLAS BAVARO was by far the best place I have been and the best week of life. I don't even know where to begin... the staff, the food, the entertainment, the beach, the rooms, everything was AWESOME!!! There was not one dull moment spent which made my departure very hard and emotional.
reviews.title: Best time eeeverrr!!!!

reviews.text: The staff at IFA are full of joy, energy, love and they never get TIRED of having fun with everyone... as they would say " I LOVE MY JOB"
reviews.title: The best holiday ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was always available when needed with a wide selection of many different delicious things. Great selection of wonderful tropical drinks- recommend the Pina Bavaro and Tequilla Sunrise!!!!
reviews.title: Do Not Order the Bloody Mary's

reviews.text: The Disco was the spot to be everynight, dancing to all types of music and having fun until 5, 6 o'clock in the morning.
reviews.title: Clean, Good Entertainment, Front Desk Needs Serious Overhaul

reviews.text: This Resort is the ultimate place to spend your vacation and TRUST me when I say its PARADISE HOTEL!!!!!!
reviews.title: Okay resort but horrible drinks
Mixed review!
reviews.text: We stayed at this resort from Feb. 17 until the 24. There was a group of 7 of us. We requested a building closest to the beach which they graciously accommodated for us! One major problem - our room had no air conditioning!!! They said they fixed it but it wasn't fixed (this was on our 4th day there). They moved us to the "Villas" which couldn't be farther from the rest of our group. The room was filthy - I guess I shouldn't complain, though, at least we weren't melting at night! We went from 2 double beds (very comfortable by the way) and nice pillows to 1 hard bed with pillows that seemed to be filled with popcorn! We rented the safe and kept our valuables (and a traveling companion's) in there. Someone actually found our safe key and stole $100! There was nothing the resort could do (of course they went through the motions and basically wasted my husband's time!). The beach - was awesome! Lots of lounge chairs and activities to do! Para-sailing was fun!! Food and drinks were close. We loved the pizza place. We loved the bars and the people working there were very pleasant. I liked the variety of entertainment on the main stage. We just wished there were other things to do at night (ie. karaokee). The food was so-so but there was a nice variety. We took the safari trip (all day) and had a blast! Be careful though, they will tell you that you get to make your own cigars (but you don't - they stop so you can buy some) and that you get to visit a school (which you don't - you drive by a couple, but you don't stop). All in all it was a lot of fun!

this hotel is underrated. The service was excellent, the staff friendly and accommodating. The largest beach area by far!!!! the rooms were clean, large and totally updated. My daughter and I (27 & 54) were treated like royalty. Definetly have the photografers (Riccot was amazing) do a portfolio for you. The food was good and they had everything you could possible ask for. We had no problems and no complaints whatsoever! We felt so save we slept on the beach one night.........the beach was cleaned every day, definetly the cleanest beach around. We are already planning our next trip and it will be to this same hotel.
reviews.title: paradise found

likes.disliked: — can't think of anything i didn't like

reviews.title: Excellent customer service by friendly skilled people
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the IFA Bavaro villas. The resort is terrific and we have never experienced such an efficient, friendly & excellent service before. It was so lovely that this "get-back-in shape" trip turned into a quality stay, full of learnings about the Dominican Republic. The climate was fantastic, the staff always welcomed us with a smile, and it was 100% possible to retreat away from the crowd if we wanted to. Excellent restaurants, high variery of food, rich & local decoration, respect of nature, cleanlyness of the whole resort, possibility to access to various activities (excursions, diving, spa, fitness, etc).

reviews.title: You Get What You Pay FOR
reviews.text: We stayed in a villa close to a 4-baths open air jacuzzi, a lounge bar & enjoyed uncredible choice at breakfast served by smily & efficient people. International, local & diet food are all available there.The pools & clean white sandy beach are lovely. Our friends appreciated the kinder-garden for their children . 1 towels per person and per day.
The Spa is very peaceful with hammam, sauna, fitness center & beauty/massage treatments upon request.
reviews.title: Has Potential But Not quite There Yet

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, nice pools, wonderful staff
likes.disliked: — The food and our initial room location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Horrible check in experience. They did not have a room for us, so we were forced to pay for an extra night, even though we already pre-paid it. It took over an hour, just to check in! The staff did not speak any english, making it very hard to communicate. The wait staff was very rude, providing very slow, horrible service & always had their hand out for a tip. The room was in serious need of renovation. The shower head was falling out of the wall, when the people next to us were using their shower, we couldn't use ours, the bed was as hard as a rock. The ONLY good thing I can say about this place, was the beach!! Oh, PS: we got scabies!!!!!
reviews.title: Bad Experience

reviews.text: Just got back from my vaca with my best friend. we stayed May 26-June 2.
reviews.title: So much fun going back!!!
Don't listen to the negative posts!!
reviews.text: It was sooo much fun so many things to do and sights to see.

reviews.title: Amazing time! Beautiful Place! Great People!
reviews.text: The people of the island and resort are so friendly and accomidating. The only thing you might want to know is that alot of people don't speak english, so brush up on spanish and a little french too. A lot of french visitors.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the food was so delicious. there were three buffets (which were free) and two restaurants which you had to pay for. we didn't feel the need to go to them because of the large range of different food at the buffets.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

likes.disliked: — The fact that air conditioning leaked, it was like taking a shower every time we went out the door

reviews.text: Well, i went to Punta Cana with a group of 23 other people to celebrate our graduation in Physical Therapy. I had read reviews before i go and i wasn't expecting good things because most of the reviews weren't good. Well, my stay at the IFA didn't start very well because me and 5 more people were putted in the villas section of the hotel, very far from our friends, who stayed in the ocean section. We complained in the reception, but they only got rooms for us there 2 days after. I didn't like that because we were promissed rooms altogether. Anyway, in relation to the rooms, i liked more the one in the villas section. Instead of the ocean section, the water always had pressure. I think, like many have said, that the rooms are the worst thing of the resort, they are old and need restyling. However, i thought the bed was good. Don't mind about the rooms because you are only there to bath and sleep.
reviews.title: Great finalists trip!! Portugal

likes.liked: — The food, the environment, the animation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relatively to restaurants, we tried the mexican, the japanese, the caribe and the normal buffet. They aren't bad, but some of the waiters aren't that nice. In the buffet, the food was pretty much the same every day, but had a lot of things to eat. I recommend the pastas. The waiters are always seeking to fill your glasses and are very helpful. However, there were 1 or 2 who weren't that nice. The Pikalo pizzeria is really good. I was always there to eat pizza and drink ''granizados''. Concerning to bars, yes, sometimes they put a lot of alcohol on the drinks but all you need to do is ask them to put less. They will do that instead. Bartenders are nice. Angel is very nice.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

likes.liked: — The cheap price and all we got with it!
likes.disliked: — Our leaking air conditioner...but it wasn't that big of a deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, the best part was the animation. They work very hard the whole day to make you feel happy and to enjoy your stay. Their energy never ends. You see them in the morning and even in the night at the disco. They were all very nice, but the ones we got more familiarized with were Henry, Bernardo, Chocolate (Beauty =) ) and Isabel. The show at night let us see the great dancing skills of the performers.
reviews.title: NIce trip for the price

reviews.text: Last but not the least lets talk about the beach and pools.
reviews.title: worst vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the pools, the one next to the stage on villas section was out of water because it was under construction. The village pool is really nice and the animation takes place there. it is next to everything. The other pool was next to Kuku Sport Bar and it was more calm then the other. Well, but for me the best place was the beach. Nice water, clean, calm and warm, nice sand and nice animation. There aren't much shadows but there is always running a little wind. Be carefull were you put your glasses or you will put the sand full of them.
reviews.title: Awful Place

description: IFA Villas Bavaro Resort & SPA is situated on the fine, white sands of Playa Bavaro. Bordered by a fabulous coral reef and surrounded by turquoise-colored waters this extraordinary vacation complex offers its guests a friendly, luxurious environment for sports & cuisine with its 6 charming restaurants and 7 spectacular bars, colorful tropical shows, a wide range of facilities and services especially designed to ensure an unforgettable stay right in heart of the Caribbean.
